dict.acceptation: 困难的；难做的；难解的；不易相处的；

sent.orig: It is more difficult on the pitch and more difficult outside.
sent.trans: 无论是场上还是场下，都比以往更加困难了。

sent.orig: It is even more difficult for newcomers to survive this difficult start-up period.
sent.trans: 而新进入者要成功度过这个开始的过程就更是困难。

sent.orig: The village is easy/difficult of access, ie easy/difficult to reach.
sent.trans: 到那个村子的路很容易[很难]走。

sent.orig: That exercise was difficult, but this is still more difficult.
sent.trans: 那个练习题难，但这一题更难。

sent.orig: That is perhaps why sculpture has been described as the most difficult of all arts;certainly it is more difficult than arts which involve appreciation of flat forms, shape in only two dimensions.
sent.trans: 人们把雕塑说成是一切艺术中最困难的，可能就是这个道理。当然，它比起只涉及平面形态，即二维形态的艺术品要困难些。
